flounder.sounds

Class PlayRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • flounder.sounds.PlayRequest

  • public class PlayRequest
extends java.lang.Object
    A request that can be sent to the DeviceSound specifying what sound should be played and what settings the source playing it should use.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float getInnerRange() 
      float getOuterRange() 
      Vector3f getPosition() 
      Sound getSound() 
      float getVolume() 
      boolean isLooping() 
      boolean isSystemSound() 
      static PlayRequest new3dSoundPlayRequest(Sound sound, float volume, Vector3f position, float innerRange, float outerRange)
      Creates a new request for playing a 3D sound, which is a sound that should appear to be emitted from somewhere in the 3D world.
      static PlayRequest newSystemPlayRequest(Sound systemSound)
      Creates a new request for playing a "system sound", which is a sound that isn't part of the 3D world and is simple played at full volume regardless of where the IAudioListener is.
      void setLooping(boolean loop)
      Indicates that the request is requesting the sound to be played on loop.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • newSystemPlayRequest

        public static PlayRequest newSystemPlayRequest(Sound systemSound)
        Creates a new request for playing a "system sound", which is a sound that isn't part of the 3D world and is simple played at full volume regardless of where the IAudioListener is.
        Parameters:
        systemSound - The sound to be played.
        Returns:
        The newly created play request.

      • new3dSoundPlayRequest

        public static PlayRequest new3dSoundPlayRequest(Sound sound,
                                                float volume,
                                                Vector3f position,
                                                float innerRange,
                                                float outerRange)
        Creates a new request for playing a 3D sound, which is a sound that should appear to be emitted from somewhere in the 3D world.
        Parameters:
        sound - The sound to be played.
        volume - The volume of the sound.
        position - The position from where the sound should be emitted.
        innerRange - The inner range of the sound. Within this range of the sound's position the sound is played at full volume.
        outerRange - The outer range of the sound. Outside this range from the sound's position the sound can't be heard at all.
        Returns:
        The newly created request.

      • getPosition

        public Vector3f getPosition()
        Returns:
        The position in the 3D world where the sound should be emitted from.

      • getInnerRange

        public float getInnerRange()
        Returns:
        The inner range of the sound. Inside this range the sound is heard at full volume.

      • getOuterRange

        public float getOuterRange()
        Returns:
        The total range of the sound. Outside this range the sound cannot be heard.

      • isSystemSound

        public boolean isSystemSound()
        Returns:
        true if the sound is a "system sound", meaning that it should be played at full volume regardless of where the IAudioListener is.

      • isLooping

        public boolean isLooping()
        Returns:
        true if the sound should be played on loop.

      • setLooping

        public void setLooping(boolean loop)
        Indicates that the request is requesting the sound to be played on loop.
        Parameters:
        loop - Whether the sound should be played on loop or not.

      • getVolume

        public float getVolume()
        Returns:
        The volume at which this sound should be played.

      • getSound

        public Sound getSound()
        Returns:
        The sound that is being requested to be played.
